text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale and on this
episode of Laura in the kitchen I want
to show you a great leftover recipe for
my cranberry sauce and muffins without
fail this recipe gets made every single
year in my house after Thanksgiving
because cranberry sauce is one of those
things that is just there's always some
leftovers of it so every year I make
these muffins and then I go on and make
a couple different recipes with it but
without fail these are definite on the
must it must make a list for the next
day or a couple days after or what not
let me take you over the ingredients so
we can get started you'll need
all-purpose flour baking powder salt
baking soda cinnamon some homemade
cranberry sauce I'll talk about this in
a minute you'll need some eggs
granite sugar unsalted butter softened
at room temperature whole milk vanilla
extract and an orange that is it now the
first thing you want to do is get your
oven preheated to 400 what I also have
here is my a nonstick muffin pan except
I did not line in with liners I ended up
spraying it liberally with some nonstick
spray the reason is because I always
find cranberry sauce to stick to my
muffin liners and that makes me crazy I
don't want to waste anything that could
stuff on the liner so this works much
better in my opinion okay my cranberry
sauce this is my cherry cranberry sauce
I made for you in previous episode if
you've seen that that's what I'm using
but any cranberry sauce will do any
homemade cranberry sauce is really best
I've never made them with those the
jelly sauce the cranberry jelly I don't
so I don't know if that will work or not
just make sure your cranberry sauce has
on hand like onions and jalapenos or
anything like that in it because I have
had those kinds of cranberry sauces and
they're delicious but they just wouldn't
go really well in this recipe okay now
in this bowl I've got some I'm gonna add
I should say my unsalted butter that's
really nice and soft
I had this sitting on the stove while
the oven preheated so it really is nice
and soft my sugar and I'm just gonna
kind of combine this together with my
spatula as best as you can you don't
have to go crazy it all end up working
out at the end I'm gonna add my eggs
a good splash of vanilla these muffins
are nothing crazy they don't require any
sort of crazy amount of ingredients but
they are divine you wait until you make
them and just a little grating of orange
zest this is optional but I think it
just makes things that much more festive
especially when those cranberries in
them and cinnamon it just works together
super super well I love the smell as
soon as you can smell the vanilla and
the orange you know good things are
gonna happen around here all right
that's plenty I'm just gonna switch to a
whisk and combine this all together
looks gray I'm just gonna add just a
little bit of milk I'm not gonna add all
of it at this point I'm just gonna

together because you want to make sure
that baking powder or salt and cinnamon
is mixed in well but you don't have to

to mix this all with your wet
ingredients get all that in there I'm
just gonna grab my spatula just to make
sure I really get it all out of there
start mixing this around with your
spatula I'm now gonna add in my
cranberry cherry sauce and then I'm just
gonna see from here how much more milk
I'm gonna need because sometimes you'll
need a quarter cup sometimes you don't
need a third sometimes we need a half a
cup so really start with a quarter cup
but if you think you'll need more like I
know I'm gonna need a little bit more
than that I'm gonna go ahead and put
another splash in that looks perfect and
I love you can see the cranberries and
the dried cherries and it's just
delicious I also have some grated apples
in there so needless to say this this
muffin is gonna be the bomb so I'm just
gonna use my handy dandy ice cream scoop
and just divide my batter evenly in my
little muffin pan perfect
oops I cept I got a little something
some here okay
these are gonna go into the oven
preheated at 400 for a good 8 15 to 18
minutes or so or until you know you
insert toothpick in the center if it
comes out clean with no wet batter on it
chances are it's done well they're done
and I'm gonna let them cool before we go
ahead and dig in my muffins were in the
evident for about 16 minutes and I've
let them cool pretty much completely and
they are just as they always are every

super easy as you can see and then you

delicious they're easy they're perfect
to make next day if you have got people
